perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by modifying the deadline for delivering a replacement copy of the Material. Originally, it was 12 months, but now it's 6 months. This creates uncertainty about the actual deadline the owner is obligated to meet, potentially leading to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
11.4  If the Licence Agreement has expired or has been lawfully terminated             this Agreement will automatically terminate on the same date.

      11.5  The Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time by giving             written notice to the Owner and NCC.

      11.6  The Owner may only terminate this Agreement with the written consent             of the Licensee.
perturbation.changed_text:
11.4  If the Licence Agreement has expired or has been lawfully terminated             this Agreement will automatically terminate on the same date.

      11.5  The Licensee may terminate this Agreement at any time by giving             written notice to the Owner and NCC.

      11.6  The Owner may terminate this agreement at any time without written concent of the Licensee.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces an in-text contradiction regarding the Owner's ability to terminate the agreement. The original text states the Owner can only terminate with the Licensee's consent, while the modified text allows the Owner to terminate at any time without such consent. This creates confusion and potential disputes regarding termination rights.

perturbation.original_text:
9.2   Upon the Material being lodged with NCC, NCC shall perform those             tests in accordance with its Standard Verification Service and shall             provide a copy of the test report to the parties to this Agreement.

      9.3   The Licensee shall be entitled to require that NCC carries out a             Full Verification. Any reasonable charges and expenses incurred by             NCC in carrying out a Full Verification will be paid by the Licensee             save that if in the opinion of the expert appointed by the Managing             Director of NCC the Material is substantially defective in content             any such reasonable charges and expenses will be paid by the Owner.
perturbation.changed_text:
9.2   Upon the Material being lodged with NCC, NCC shall perform those             tests in accordance with its Standard Verification Service and shall             provide a copy of the test report to the parties to this Agreement.

      9.3   The Licensee shall be entitled to require that NCC carries out a             Full Verification. All charges and expenses incurred by             NCC in carrying out a Full Verification will be paid by the Owner.
perturbation.explanation: This modification causes a contradiction concerning who pays for a Full Verification. The initial text specifies the Licensee pays, unless the material is defective, in which case the Owner pays. The modified version states that the Owner always pays, creating ambiguity and potential disagreement over payment obligations.
